parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Positions </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Converts position in world space into screen (UI) space. If a specified position is not within the current screen view, an empty array is returned. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[worldToScreen]] position </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> position: [[Array]] - World position 2D [x,y] or [[PositionAGL]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - Screen position [x,y] (see [[SafeZone]] for more info) - [] if not on-screen </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_screenPos = [[worldToScreen]] [[getPos]] soldier1;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_screenPos = [[worldToScreen]] ([[player]] [[modelToWorld]] [0,10,0]);</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[screenToWorld]], [[SafeZone]]  </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on august 19th, 2012 - 19:19 (GMT+1)
<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]
<dd class="note"> please take [[SafeZone|safezones]] in consideration: the returned result can be out of the [0,0]..[1,1] range and can also be a filled array even if the position is not displayed on your monitor - this command thinks of triplescreens configurations as well. [] returned = not rendered

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
